project.description: A project that has integrations with OpenStack cloud

property.description: Property sheet to hold XML specification for forms for configurations

formalParameter.description: A unique name for the connection. You may have to create additional connections in the future.
User name and password for the OpenStack account. It must have enough privileges to run API functions.
Level for the output: 0 = only errors, 1 = normal headers and responses, 2 = including debugging information
A brief description of this configuration.
The name of the resource (or pool) on which the integration steps can run (default is 'local').
The Compute service API version
Keystone API Version
The host name or IP address of the Identity Service for OpenStack
The host name or IP address of the Compute Service for OpenStack
The host name or IP address of the Block Storage for OpenStack
Blockstorage API Version
The host name or IP address of the Image Service for OpenStack
The host name or IP address of the Orchestration Service for OpenStack
Image API Version
The workspace used by resources that are dynamically created by this configuration. The default is "default."
Configuration Name.
Security Group(s)
Existing Key Pair name

procedure.description: Create a new OpenStack floating IP.
Delete an existing OpenStack floating IP.
Associate Floating IP to an existing instance.
Hook for CloudManager to remove servers

formalParameter.description: A list of deployments to stop
The name of the configuration that has all the connection information for OpenStack.

procedure.description: Hook for CloudManager to add servers

formalParameter.description: Number of new servers
Pool name for creating resources

procedure.description: Reboots an instance of a server.
Creates a snapshot of a volume.
Creates a snapshot of an instance.
Creates a new heat stack from a template..
Hook used by CloudManager to synchronize servers

formalParameter.description: A list of deployments to stop
The name of the configuration that has all the connection information for OpenStack.
